medical_history.chief_complaint: Difficulty walking, fatigue, confusion, and insomnia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately four weeks before admission with severe fatigue, frequent yawning, and difficulty concentrating. Insomnia, intermittent confusion, and unsteadiness of gait developed. Symptoms progressed with multiple breaks needed during daily activities and progressively worsening insomnia, unsteadiness, and confusion noted during physician visits.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, aortic stenosis, transient ischemic attack 20 years earlier, chronic hearing loss, muscle changes and sensory loss in one leg from war injuries, and a basal-cell carcinoma of the right inner canthus that was irradiated. Right cataract surgery with lens implantation.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of cardiovascular disease at 80 years of age; one brother alive with lymphoma; a sister had schizophrenia; another brother and sister were well. Motherâ€™s cause of death not known.
medical_history.social_history: Widowed and lived alone. Two sons are well. Semiretired businessman, consumed one to two alcoholic beverages per day, and had smoked cigarettes in the remote past.
